Description: Terracotta cooking stove fragment. A pot-support: a theatre mask of Seilenos with pointed ears, his beard almost completely lost; he is bald, with hair above the ears, or wears an indeterminate wreath. The rectangular panel in which the mask is set is edged on three sides with a floral scroll. The back is plain, and no trace of the bowl to which it was attached survives. Pressed into a one-piece mould. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt with a red and grey-brown core; some white grits. Traces of burning through use. Red surface, possibly a thin slip or wash.
Curator's comments: Published (Sahin 2001, 120, fig. 115: Na 7). Şahin, M. 2001. Hellenistic braziers in the British Museum: Trade contacts between ancient Mediterranean cities. Anatolian Studies 51: 91-132.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3680)
Şahin 2001 / Hellenistic braziers in the British Museum: Trade contacts between ancient Mediterranean cities (p.120, fig. 115: Na 7)
